channel.title: I bring you... the Xen Levels in Black Mesa
channel.description:
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TIRrDcMMGJU']Literally.[/url]
:3
[COLOR='Black']*trollface* :retard:
____
[b]UPDATE[/b]
First Xen map (and a modified version of the preceding Lambda Core map) is up for download here:
[url]https://www.gamefront.com/files/22396510/xBM_R1.zip[/url]
MATERIALS AND TEXTURES ARE [b][i][u]NOT[/u][/i][/b] INCLUDED! YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR OWNING HALF-LIFE: SOURCE AND EXTRACTING THE RELEVANT FILES TO THE PROPER BLACK MESA DIRECTORIES YOURSELF.
When in doubt, just extract the entire "xeno" folder from HL:S to [i]BMS\materials[/i]. You'll also need everything pertaining to the skybox [i]neb7[/i].
_____
[b]Clarification[/b]
This is not intended to be an exhaustively awesome attempt at creating a Xen for Black Mesa before the Devs do. Rather, it's meant to hold us over during the wait for Xen, via laughs and giggles by seeing just how crappy the original Half-Life Xen low-poly geometry and low-res textures were, in comparison to Black Mesa's hi-def weapons and NPCs.
This is meant to be nothing more than a STRAIGHT PORT of the original Half-Life Xen levels to the Black Mesa game. It is in no way representative of how Xen will actually look like in Black Mesa. Please don't misinterpret my intent. This is meant to be a half-assed joke project, although it admittedly takes more effort than one might think. If you wish to volunteer to help with the porting project, PM me and I'll see what you can work on. :slight_smile:

giorgi:

and if you wont come with me

You
a. don’t know English and so you’re using Google translator
b. are a troll

One answer or another, you’re being rude and maybe that’s why nobody wants to answer your question … if you want help, please be patient, devs have a lot of work to do and they’re doing their best to work in their ordinary lives (and many other people here on forums), work on the mod and talk with us on forums…
